https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/94948

---

This issue has been escalated to [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra):
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra/issues/250

Please wait until it is solved there.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, you’re probably already using AdGuard Extra so you just need to wait until it is updated.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/94948

---

This issue has been escalated to [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra):
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra/issues/250

Please wait until it is solved there.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, you’re probably already using AdGuard Extra so you just need to wait until it is updated.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

review.body:
@piquark6046 any updates on this?
I suggest you add the scriptlet https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/pull/133245#pullrequestreview-1156423507 and exceptions under the directive for content blockers.
Something like that
```
work.ink#%#//scriptlet('prevent-setTimeout', 'sas_26322')
!#if (adguard_ext_android_cb)
@@||cmp.quantcast.com/choice/*/choice.js$domain=work.ink
@@||cmp.quantcast.com/tcfv2/*/cmp2.js$domain=work.ink
@@||cdn.thisiswaldo.com/static/js/11929.js$domain=work.ink
@@||cdn.taboola.com/libtrc/workink/loader.js$domain=work.ink
@@||securepubads.g.doubleclick.net/tag/js/gpt.js$domain=work.ink
@@||adservice.google.com/adsid/$domain=work.ink
@@||adservice.google.co.*/adsid/$domain=work.ink
work.ink#@##AdHeader
work.ink#@##AD_Top
work.ink#@##homead
work.ink#@##ad-lead
!#endif
```

Not reproduced this with our filters on my end.
Leave only AdGuard filters and try to clear browser data, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://www.bing.com/search?q=fritz+dect+302&go=Suche&qs=ds&form=QBRE](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bing.com%2Fsearch%3Fq%3Dfritz%2Bdect%2B302%26go%3DSuche%26qs%3Dds%26form%3DQBRE) ### Comment Username: @tox1c90 > I think I understand now what the problem is that in some cases Bing ads are slipping through. Just noticed by chance that ALL of my search results are served as IMAGES/blobs instead of text. Only the headlines and URLs can be selected and copied as text, the actual preview of each result including the "ad" marker is contained in an image object, if you try to select the text with your mouse/cursor one actually drags the whole thing around. > This is not only the case for ads, but for all search results when Adguard is enabled. > > In inPrivate mode of the browser, this does not happen, and all search results are served as proper selectable text. And then, Adguard is able to block all ads. > > So the ads are obviously not missed by the filter, but it's Bing running some kind of Adblock detection, which switches the way search results are delivered from text mode to small inline images/snippets/blobs. > > Anything one can do to get around this? Better way of hiding Adguard? ### Screenshots

comment.body:
Not reproduced this with our filters and stealth mode on my end.
Try to disable stealth mode options one by one to find a problematic one.
When you find it, turn it on, add the rule `@@||ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/$stealth` and check the site again.
If that helps, please write here.

comment.body:
Actually, scriptlets are supported by AdGuard for iOS, but if iOS >= 15. as I recall.
You can extend the directive as
```
!#if (adguard_ext_android_cb || adguard_app_ios || adguard_ext_safari)
```

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://www.bing.com/search?q=fritz+dect+302&go=Suche&qs=ds&form=QBRE](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bing.com%2Fsearch%3Fq%3Dfritz%2Bdect%2B302%26go%3DSuche%26qs%3Dds%26form%3DQBRE) ### Comment Username: @tox1c90 > I think I understand now what the problem is that in some cases Bing ads are slipping through. Just noticed by chance that ALL of my search results are served as IMAGES/blobs instead of text. Only the headlines and URLs can be selected and copied as text, the actual preview of each result including the "ad" marker is contained in an image object, if you try to select the text with your mouse/cursor one actually drags the whole thing around. > This is not only the case for ads, but for all search results when Adguard is enabled. > > In inPrivate mode of the browser, this does not happen, and all search results are served as proper selectable text. And then, Adguard is able to block all ads. > > So the ads are obviously not missed by the filter, but it's Bing running some kind of Adblock detection, which switches the way search results are delivered from text mode to small inline images/snippets/blobs. > > Anything one can do to get around this? Better way of hiding Adguard? ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/RuaiVmm.png)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/tkZXG28.png)

```adblock
bing.com##html > body .b_ad
```

to user rules.

@tox1c90  Could you please add this rule:
```adblock
bing.com#$?#.b_restorableLink { remove: true; }
```
to user rules and then check out if you still see these ads?

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://www.bing.com/search?q=fritz+dect+302&go=Suche&qs=ds&form=QBRE](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bing.com%2Fsearch%3Fq%3Dfritz%2Bdect%2B302%26go%3DSuche%26qs%3Dds%26form%3DQBRE) ### Comment Username: @tox1c90 > I think I understand now what the problem is that in some cases Bing ads are slipping through. Just noticed by chance that ALL of my search results are served as IMAGES/blobs instead of text. Only the headlines and URLs can be selected and copied as text, the actual preview of each result including the "ad" marker is contained in an image object, if you try to select the text with your mouse/cursor one actually drags the whole thing around. > This is not only the case for ads, but for all search results when Adguard is enabled. > > In inPrivate mode of the browser, this does not happen, and all search results are served as proper selectable text. And then, Adguard is able to block all ads. > > So the ads are obviously not missed by the filter, but it's Bing running some kind of Adblock detection, which switches the way search results are delivered from text mode to small inline images/snippets/blobs. > > Anything one can do to get around this? Better way of hiding Adguard? ### Screenshots

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://www.bing.com/search?q=fritz+dect+302&go=Suche&qs=ds&form=QBRE](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bing.com%2Fsearch%3Fq%3Dfritz%2Bdect%2B302%26go%3DSuche%26qs%3Dds%26form%3DQBRE) ### Comment Username: @tox1c90 > I think I understand now what the problem is that in some cases Bing ads are slipping through. Just noticed by chance that ALL of my search results are served as IMAGES/blobs instead of text. Only the headlines and URLs can be selected and copied as text, the actual preview of each result including the "ad" marker is contained in an image object, if you try to select the text with your mouse/cursor one actually drags the whole thing around. > This is not only the case for ads, but for all search results when Adguard is enabled. > > In inPrivate mode of the browser, this does not happen, and all search results are served as proper selectable text. And then, Adguard is able to block all ads. > > So the ads are obviously not missed by the filter, but it's Bing running some kind of Adblock detection, which switches the way search results are delivered from text mode to small inline images/snippets/blobs. > > Anything one can do to get around this? comment.body: Реклама не повторилась.

Actually, it's `antiblock.org g207`.
You can find the rules using search `! SECTION: antiblock.org g207`.
What you need to do:
1. Remove your rules (just the domain)
2. Add the domain to the current scriptlet `#%#//scriptlet('abort-current-inline-script', 'document.addEventListener', 'displayMessage:')`
3. Add `@@||prz.pw^$generichide` to the content_blocker.txt. You'll find the same category there.

pull_request.title: Add iOS-compatible regex for too common revolving adservers
pull_request.body:
## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

Those regex
```
/^https?:\/\/(?:www\.)?[a-z0-9-]{5,}\.(?:com|bid|online|top|club)\/[0-9a-f]{32}\/invoke\.js/$script,third-party
/^https?:\/\/(?:www\.|[a-z0-9]{7,10}\.)?[a-z0-9-]{5,}\.(?:com|bid|link|live|online|top|club)\/(?:[a-z0-9]{2}\/){2,3}[a-f0-9]{32}\.js/$script,xmlhttprequest,third-party
```
have been catching so many revolving adservers for years, but are not compatible to CB. The result is iOS users see a lot more ads/popup by them than other platforms.

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

Many, I'm sure you know.

### Enter the issue address

An example of the first regex is currently seen on `www.tvsubtitles.net​` and the second `avgle.com` on my side, but they may change.

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

I don't know whether `(?:www\.)?` works on CB so didn't add. Tell me if it works. I concentrated on covering as much targets by as simple regex as possible.

- Almost 100% of them now use .com domain
- There are certainly cases starting from www or pl******* but rather rare
- `(?:[a-z0-9]{2}\/)` repeated only two times is rare

Also the original regex put in specific.txt seems to be only historical reason, they are generic pattern so moved to general_url.txt.

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

pull_request.title: Add iOS-compatible regex for too common revolving adservers
pull_request.body:
## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

Those regex
```
/^https?:\/\/(?:www\.)?[a-z0-9-]{5,}\.(?:com|bid|online|top|club)\/[0-9a-f]{32}\/invoke\.js/$script,third-party
/^https?:\/\/(?:www\.|[a-z0-9]{7,10}\.)?[a-z0-9-]{5,}\.(?:com|bid|link|live|online|top|club)\/(?:[a-z0-9]{2}\/){2,3}[a-f0-9]{32}\.js/$script,xmlhttprequest,third-party
```
have been catching so many revolving adservers for years, but are not compatible to CB. The result is iOS users see a lot more ads/popup by them than other platforms.

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

Many, I'm sure you know.

### Enter the issue address

An example of the first regex is currently seen on `www.tvsubtitles.net​` and the second `avgle.com` on my side, but they may change.

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

I don't know whether `(?:www\.)?` works on CB so didn't add. Tell me if it works. I concentrated on covering as much targets by as simple regex as possible.

- Almost 100% of them now use .com domain
- There are certainly cases starting from www or pl******* but rather rare
- `(?:[a-z0-9]{2}\/)` repeated only two times is rare

Also the original regex put in specific.txt seems to be only historical reason, they are generic pattern so moved to general_url.txt.

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

pull_request.title: Add iOS-compatible regex for too common revolving adservers
pull_request.body:
## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

Those regex
```
/^https?:\/\/(?:www\.)?[a-z0-9-]{5,}\.(?:com|bid|online|top|club)\/[0-9a-f]{32}\/invoke\.js/$script,third-party
/^https?:\/\/(?:www\.|[a-z0-9]{7,10}\.)?[a-z0-9-]{5,}\.(?:com|bid|link|live|online|top|club)\/(?:[a-z0-9]{2}\/){2,3}[a-f0-9]{32}\.js/$script,xmlhttprequest,third-party
```
have been catching so many revolving adservers for years, but are not compatible to CB. The result is iOS users see a lot more ads/popup by them than other platforms.

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

Many, I'm sure you know.

### Enter the issue address

An example of the first regex is currently seen on `www.tvsubtitles.net​` and the second `avgle.com` on my side, but they may change.

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

I don't know whether `(?:www\.)?` works on CB so didn't add. Tell me if it works. I concentrated on covering as much targets by as simple regex as possible.

- Almost 100% of them now use .com domain
- There are certainly cases starting from www or pl******* but rather rare
- `(?:[a-z0-9]{2}\/)` repeated only two times is rare

Also the original regex put in specific.txt seems to be only historical reason, they are generic pattern so moved to general_url.txt.

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;

### Problem description

My issue is that the app doesnt work with the rules that i usually set in my devices.
First I blocked every port with
/.+/$network
Than I unlocked the ports:
53 80 443 853 3000 5443
With @@*: [port]^$network

But I can t surf for dns problems, what i'm missing?
I'm on an android device with the dedicated vpn to adguard.

Is it possible to create a dynamic filtering with the input closed (or drop)?

No solution guessed

_No response_
